intro: Pseudoliparis tubulosa, commonly known as the tubular sea anemone, is a unique marine organism belonging to the family Actinidiidae. It is characterized by its slender, tubular body and a crown of tentacles surrounding its oral disc. This species is typically found in shallow coastal waters, where it attaches itself to rocky substrates. Its structure resembles a sea anemone, but it lacks the typical polyp morphology seen in true anemones. Pseudoliparis tubulosa plays a role in marine ecosystems by providing habitat for small invertebrates and contributing to the biodiversity of its environment.
